requirements.summary: Create expense entry form with amount, category, description, and date fields
acceptanceCriteria: Form validates required fields before submission
Category can be selected from predefined options or entered as custom text
Date defaults to current date but can be changed
Success feedback is shown after successful submission

file_operations.description: Create a form component for adding expense entries with fields for amount (numeric), category (select/input combo), description (text), and date (date picker). Include form validation and call the addExpense backend method. Show success feedback after submission.
Wire the ExpenseForm component into the main application layout so users can access it to add expenses.

requirements.summary: Create monthly earnings form for setting earnings by month and year
acceptanceCriteria: User can input monthly earnings amount
Month and year can be selected
Form validates positive numeric input
Success feedback is shown after saving

file_operations.description: Create a form component for setting monthly earnings with fields for amount (positive numeric validation), month selector, and year selector. Call the setMonthlyEarnings backend method and display success feedback.
Wire the EarningsForm component into the main application layout so users can set their monthly earnings.

requirements.summary: Create dashboard showing category-wise expense breakdown with totals and percentages
acceptanceCriteria: Categories are listed with their total expense amounts
Percentage breakdown is calculated and displayed for each category
Data updates when a different month is selected
Visual representation makes it easy to compare categories

file_operations.description: Create a dashboard component that fetches expenses using getExpensesByMonthYear, groups them by category, calculates totals and percentages, and displays them in a card-based layout with visual hierarchy. Include category icons from frontend/public/assets/generated/category-icons.dim_200x200.png.
Wire the CategoryBreakdown component into the main dashboard view and pass the selected month and year as props.

requirements.summary: Create summary section showing earnings, expenses, and savings for selected month
acceptanceCriteria: Shows monthly earnings prominently
Shows total expenses for the month
Shows calculated savings (earnings minus expenses)
Visual indicators distinguish positive savings from negative (overspending)
Updates when month selection changes

file_operations.description: Create a summary component that fetches monthly earnings using getMonthlyEarnings, calculates total expenses from getExpensesByMonthYear, and displays savings using getMonthlySavings. Use visual indicators (colors, icons) to distinguish positive savings from overspending. Display the financial-growth.dim_400x300.png image from frontend/public/assets/generated/financial-growth.dim_400x300.png when showing positive savings.
Wire the MonthlySummary component into the dashboard view above or beside the category breakdown, passing selected month and year as props.

requirements.summary: Create expense list view with edit and delete functionality
acceptanceCriteria: All expenses for the selected month are listed
Each entry shows date, category, description, and amount
Edit functionality allows modifying existing expenses
Delete functionality removes expenses with confirmation
List updates in real-time after add, edit, or delete operations

file_operations.description: Create a list component that displays all expenses for the selected month using getExpensesByMonthYear. Each item shows date, category, description, and amount with edit and delete buttons. Include inline editing or modal for updates using updateExpense, and confirmation dialog for deleteExpense. Use React Query for real-time updates.
Wire the ExpenseList component into the dashboard view below the summary and breakdown sections, passing selected month and year as props.

requirements.summary: Implement month and year selector for filtering dashboard data
acceptanceCriteria: User can select month and year from dropdown or calendar picker
Default selection is the current month and year
All dashboard data updates when selection changes
Selection persists during the session

file_operations.description: Create a month and year selector component using dropdowns or a date picker. Default to current month and year. Emit onChange events with selected month and year values. Use session storage or React state to persist selection.
Wire the MonthYearSelector component at the top of the dashboard. Manage selected month and year in state and pass them to MonthlySummary, CategoryBreakdown, and ExpenseList components.

requirements.summary: Design cohesive visual theme with warm colors, clean typography, and card-based layout
acceptanceCriteria: Visual theme is consistent across all pages and components
Color scheme enhances readability and creates visual hierarchy
Layout is intuitive and makes financial data easy to scan
Typography clearly distinguishes monetary values from labels

file_operations.description: Define global CSS custom properties for warm, earthy color palette (e.g., soft oranges, browns, greens) and typography scale with clear hierarchy for financial numbers vs. labels. Ensure consistent spacing and card styling.

Extend Tailwind theme with custom color palette matching the warm, approachable visual theme. Configure typography plugin for number-specific font families and weights to enhance financial data readability.

requirements.summary: Display generated images as static assets in appropriate UI locations
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are properly loaded from the static assets directory
Images are displayed with appropriate sizing and positioning
Fallback handling exists if images fail to load

file_operations.description: Add an img element to display frontend/public/assets/generated/financial-growth.dim_400x300.png in the savings section with appropriate sizing (max-width and responsive classes). Include alt text and error handling for failed image loads.

Reference frontend/public/assets/generated/category-icons.dim_200x200.png for category visual indicators. Use sprite techniques or individual icon rendering based on category names with fallback handling.
